appendix.title: Standards, RFCs, & Internet-Drafts
appendix.para: OpenDJ software implements the following RFCs, Internet-Drafts, and standards.

term.link: RFC 1274: The COSINE and Internet X.500 Schema

listitem.para: X.500 Directory Schema, or Naming Architecture, for use in the COSINE and Internet X.500 pilots.

term.link: RFC 1321: The MD5 Message-Digest Algorithm

listitem.para: MD5 message-digest algorithm that takes as input a message of arbitrary length and produces as output a 128-bit "fingerprint" or "message digest" of the input.

term.link: RFC 1777: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAPv2)

listitem.para: Provide access to the X.500 Directory while not incurring the resource requirements of the Directory Access Protocol.
Classified as an Historic document.

term.link: RFC 1778: The String Representation of Standard Attribute Syntaxes

listitem.para: Defines the requirements that must be satisfied by encoding rules used to render X.500 Directory attribute syntaxes into a form suitable for use in the LDAP, then defines the encoding rules for the standard set of attribute syntaxes.
Classified as an Historic document.

term.link: RFC 1779: A String Representation of Distinguished Names

listitem.para: Defines a string format for representing names, which is designed to give a clean representation of commonly used names, whilst being able to represent any distinguished name.
Classified as an Historic document.

term.link: RFC 2079: Definition of an X.500 Attribute Type and an Object Class to Hold Uniform Resource Identifiers (URIs)

listitem.para: Defines a new attribute type and an auxiliary object class to allow URIs, including URLs, to be stored in directory entries in a standard way.

term.link: RFC 2222: Simple Authentication and Security Layer (SASL)

listitem.para: Describes a method for adding authentication support to connection-based protocols.

term.link: RFC 2246: The TLS Protocol Version 1.0

listitem.para: Specifies Version 1.0 of the Transport Layer Security protocol.

term.link: RFC 2247: Using Domains in LDAP/X.500 Distinguished Names

listitem.para: Defines an algorithm by which a name registered with the Internet Domain Name Service can be represented as an LDAP distinguished name.

term.link: RFC 2251: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (v3)

listitem.para: Describes a directory access protocol designed to provide access to directories supporting the X.500 models, while not incurring the resource requirements of the X.500 Directory Access Protocol.

term.link: RFC 2252: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (v3): Attribute Syntax Definitions

listitem.para: Defines a set of syntaxes for LDAPv3, and the rules by which attribute values of these syntaxes are represented as octet strings for transmission in the LDAP protocol.

term.link: RFC 2253: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (v3): UTF-8 String Representation of Distinguished Names

listitem.para: Defines a common UTF-8 format to represent distinguished names unambiguously.

term.link: RFC 2254: The String Representation of LDAP Search Filters

listitem.para: Defines the string format for representing names, which is designed to give a clean representation of commonly used distinguished names, while being able to represent any distinguished name.

term.link: RFC 2255: The LDAP URL Format

listitem.para: Describes a format for an LDAP Uniform Resource Locator.

term.link: RFC 2256: A Summary of the X.500(96) User Schema for use with LDAPv3

listitem.para: Provides an overview of the attribute types and object classes defined by the ISO and ITU-T committees in the X.500 documents, in particular those intended for use by directory clients.

term.link: RFC 2307: An Approach for Using LDAP as a Network Information Service

listitem.para: Describes an experimental mechanism for mapping entities related to TCP/IP and the UNIX system into X.500 entries so that they may be resolved with the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol.

term.link: RFC 2377: Naming Plan for Internet Directory-Enabled Applications

listitem.para: Proposes a new directory naming plan that leverages the strengths of the most popular and successful Internet naming schemes for naming objects in a hierarchical directory.

term.link: RFC 2696: LDAP Control Extension for Simple Paged Results Manipulation

listitem.para: Allows a client to control the rate at which an LDAP server returns the results of an LDAP search operation.

term.link: RFC 2713: Schema for Representing Java(tm) Objects in an LDAP Directory

listitem.para: Defines a common way for applications to store and retrieve Java objects from the directory.

term.link: RFC 2714: Schema for Representing CORBA Object References in an LDAP Directory

listitem.para: Define a common way for applications to store and retrieve CORBA object references from the directory.

term.link: RFC 2739: Calendar Attributes for vCard and LDAP

listitem.para: Defines a mechanism to locate a user calendar and free/busy time using the LDAP protocol.

term.link: RFC 2798: Definition of the inetOrgPerson LDAP Object Class

listitem.para: Define an object class called inetOrgPerson for use in LDAP and X.500 directory services that extends the X.521 standard organizationalPerson class.

term.link: RFC 2829: Authentication Methods for LDAP

listitem.para: Specifies particular combinations of security mechanisms which are required and recommended in LDAP implementations.

term.link: RFC 2830: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (v3): Extension for Transport Layer Security

listitem.para: Defines the "Start Transport Layer Security (TLS) Operation" for LDAP.

term.link: RFC 2849: The LDAP Data Interchange Format (LDIF) - Technical Specification

listitem.para: Describes a file format suitable for describing directory information or modifications made to directory information.

term.link: RFC 2891: LDAP Control Extension for Server Side Sorting of Search Results

listitem.para: Describes two LDAPv3 control extensions for server side sorting of search results.

term.link: RFC 2926: Conversion of LDAP Schemas to and from SLP Templates

listitem.para: Describes a procedure for mapping between Service Location Protocol service advertisements and lightweight directory access protocol descriptions of services.

term.link: RFC 3045: Storing Vendor Information in the LDAP root DSE

listitem.para: Specifies two Lightweight Directory Access Protocol attributes, vendorName and vendorVersion that MAY be included in the root DSA-specific Entry (DSE) to advertise vendor-specific information.

term.link: RFC 3062: LDAP Password Modify Extended Operation

listitem.para: Describes an LDAP extended operation to allow modification of user passwords which is not dependent upon the form of the authentication identity nor the password storage mechanism used.

term.link: RFC 3112: LDAP Authentication Password Schema

listitem.para: Describes schema in support of user/password authentication in a LDAP directory including the authPassword attribute type. This attribute type holds values derived from the user's password(s) (commonly using cryptographic strength one-way hash).

term.link: RFC 3377: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (v3): Technical Specification

listitem.para: Specifies the set of RFCs comprising the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol Version 3 (LDAPv3), and addresses the "IESG Note" attached to RFCs 2251 through 2256.

term.link: RFC 3383: Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) Considerations for the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP)

listitem.para: Provides procedures for registering extensible elements of the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP).

term.link: RFC 3546: Transport Layer Security (TLS) Extensions

listitem.para: Describes extensions that may be used to add functionality to Transport Layer Security.

term.link: RFC 3671: Collective Attributes in the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP)

listitem.para: Summarizes the X.500 information model for collective attributes and describes use of collective attributes in LDAP.

term.link: RFC 3672: Subentries in the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP)

listitem.para: Adapts X.500 subentries mechanisms for use with the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP).

term.link: RFC 3673: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol version 3 (LDAPv3): All Operational Attributes

listitem.para: Describes an LDAP extension which clients may use to request the return of all operational attributes.

term.link: RFC 3674: Feature Discovery in Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP)

listitem.para: Introduces a general mechanism for discovery of elective features and extensions which cannot be discovered using existing mechanisms.

term.link: RFC 3771: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) Intermediate Response Message

listitem.para: Defines and describes the IntermediateResponse message, a general mechanism for defining single-request/multiple-response operations in Lightweight Directory Access Protocol.

term.link: RFC 3829: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) Authorization Identity Request and Response Controls

listitem.para: Extends the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol bind operation with a mechanism for requesting and returning the authorization identity it establishes.

term.link: RFC 3876: Returning Matched Values with the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol version 3 (LDAPv3)

listitem.para: Describes a control for the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol version 3 that is used to return a subset of attribute values from an entry.

term.link: RFC 3909: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) Cancel Operation

listitem.para: Describes a Lightweight Directory Access Protocol extended operation to cancel (or abandon) an outstanding operation, with a response to indicate the outcome of the operation.

term.link: RFC 4346: The Transport Layer Security (TLS) Protocol Version 1.1

listitem.para: Specifies Version 1.1 of the Transport Layer Security protocol.

term.link: RFC 4370: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) Proxied Authorization Control

listitem.para: Defines the Proxy Authorization Control, that allows a client to request that an operation be processed under a provided authorization identity instead of under the current authorization identity associated with the connection.

term.link: RFC 4403: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) Schema for Universal Description, Discovery, and Integration version 3 (UDDIv3)

listitem.para: Defines the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol schema for representing Universal Description, Discovery, and Integration data types in an LDAP directory.

term.link: RFC 4422: Simple Authentication and Security Layer (SASL)

listitem.para: Describes a framework for providing authentication and data security services in connection-oriented protocols via replaceable mechanisms.

term.link: RFC 4505: Anonymous Simple Authentication and Security Layer (SASL) Mechanism

listitem.para: Describes a new way to provide anonymous login is needed within the context of the Simple Authentication and Security Layer framework.

term.link: RFC 4510: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP): Technical Specification Road Map

listitem.para: Provides a road map of the LDAP Technical Specification.

term.link: RFC 4511: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP): The Protocol

listitem.para: Describes the protocol elements, along with their semantics and encodings, of the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol.

term.link: RFC 4512: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP): Directory Information Models

listitem.para: Describes the X.500 Directory Information Models as used in LDAP.

term.link: RFC 4513: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP): Authentication Methods and Security Mechanisms

listitem.para: Describes authentication methods and security mechanisms of the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol.

term.link: RFC 4514: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP): String Representation of Distinguished Names

listitem.para: Defines the string representation used in the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol to transfer distinguished names.

term.link: RFC 4515: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP): String Representation of Search Filters

listitem.para: Defines a human-readable string representation of LDAP search filters that is appropriate for use in LDAP URLs and in other applications.

term.link: RFC 4516: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP): Uniform Resource Locator

listitem.para: Describes a format for a Lightweight Directory Access Protocol Uniform Resource Locator.

term.link: RFC 4517: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP): Syntaxes and Matching Rules

listitem.para: Defines a base set of syntaxes and matching rules for use in defining attributes for LDAP directories.

term.link: RFC 4518: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP): Internationalized String Preparation

listitem.para: Defines string preparation algorithms for character-based matching rules defined for use in LDAP.

term.link: RFC 4519: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP): Schema for User Applications

listitem.para: Provides a technical specification of attribute types and object classes intended for use by LDAP directory clients for many directory services, such as White Pages.

term.link: RFC 4524: COSINE LDAP/X.500 Schema

listitem.para: Provides a collection of schema elements for use with the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol from the COSINE and Internet X.500 pilot projects.

term.link: RFC 4525: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) Modify-Increment Extension

listitem.para: Describes an extension to the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol Modify operation to support an increment capability.

term.link: RFC 4526: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) Absolute True and False Filters

listitem.para: Extends the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol to support absolute True and False filters based upon similar capabilities found in X.500 directory systems.

term.link: RFC 4527: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) Read Entry Controls

listitem.para: Specifies an extension to the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol to allow the client to read the target entry of an update operation.

term.link: RFC 4528: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) Assertion Control

listitem.para: Defines the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol Assertion Control, which allows a client to specify that a directory operation should only be processed if an assertion applied to the target entry of the operation is true.

term.link: RFC 4529: Requesting Attributes by Object Class in the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP)

listitem.para: Extends LDAP to support a mechanism that LDAP clients may use to request the return of all attributes of an object class.

term.link: RFC 4530: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) entryUUID Operational Attribute

listitem.para: Describes the LDAP/X.500 'entryUUID' operational attribute and associated matching rules and syntax.

term.link: RFC 4532: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) "Who am I?" Operation

listitem.para: Provides a mechanism for Lightweight Directory Access Protocol clients to obtain the authorization identity the server has associated with the user or application entity.

term.link: RFC 4616: The PLAIN Simple Authentication and Security Layer (SASL) Mechanism

listitem.para: Defines a simple clear-text user/password Simple Authentication and Security Layer mechanism called the PLAIN mechanism.

term.link: RFC 4634: US Secure Hash Algorithms (SHA and HMAC-SHA)

listitem.para: Specifies Secure Hash Algorithms, SHA-256, SHA-384, and SHA-512, for computing a condensed representation of a message or a data file.

term.link: RFC 4752: The Kerberos V5 ("GSSAPI") Simple Authentication and Security Layer (SASL) Mechanism

listitem.para: Describes the method for using the Generic Security Service Application Program Interface (GSS-API) Kerberos V5 in the Simple Authentication and Security Layer, called the GSSAPI mechanism.

term.link: RFC 4876: A Configuration Profile Schema for Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP)-Based Agents

listitem.para: Defines a schema for storing a profile for agents that make use of the Lightweight Directory Access protocol (LDAP).

term.link: RFC 5020: The Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) entryDN Operational Attribute

listitem.para: Describes the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) / X.500 'entryDN' operational attribute, that provides a copy of the entry's distinguished name for use in attribute value assertions.

term.link: FIPS 180-1: Secure Hash Standard (SHA-1)

listitem.para: Specifies a Secure Hash Algorithm, SHA-1, for computing a condensed representation of a message or a data file.

term.link: FIPS 180-2: Secure Hash Standard (SHA-1, SHA-256, SHA-384, SHA-512)

listitem.para: Specifies four Secure Hash Algorithms for computing a condensed representation of electronic data.

term.link: DSMLv2: Directory Service Markup Language

listitem.para: Provides a method for expressing directory queries and updates as XML documents.

term.link: JavaScript Object Notation

listitem.para: A data-interchange format that aims to be both "easy for humans to read and write," and also "easy for machines to parse and generate."

term.link: Simple Cloud Identity Management: Core Schema 1.0

listitem.para: Platform neutral schema and extension model for representing users and groups in JSON and XML formats. OpenDJ supports the JSON formats.
